page.title: 13Salmon Fishing on the Dee
page.content: The River Dee stretches over 70 miles & is famous for salmon fishing. As it passes through an estate it gives the owner the right to issue permits for fishing the waters. In this area of Crathie and Balmoral 6 fishers can fish 6 days a week from April to Sept. No licence is needed to buy or use a fishing rod but you do have to have a permit obtained from the Estate owner. This year was a good year for salmon as the water level was high. On Balmoral this season there have been about 107 salmon and 14 sea trout caught, the 2 biggest weighing 21lbs. "The fishers get up at 8am and return at 5pm. They are only allowed to catch 3 fish a day and take 2 rods with them 2 ghillies go with them. You are not allowed to fish without permission from the Laird. If you get caught like my uncle did you get fined Â£55."
